Name: Ennorath
Construction: middle E - en- S; land / earth E - nor S; -ath S - plural

Name: Endor
Construction: en- Q - mid- E

Name: Gondor
Construction: gond S - stone E; dor S - land E

Name: Calenardhon
Construction: calen S - green E; ardhon S - realm E

Name: Forodwaith
Construction: northern E > forod S; realm E > gwaith S; forod + gwaith S > forodwaith S

Name: Haradwaith
Construction: southern E > harad S; realm E > gwaith; harad + gwaith S > haradwaith S

Name: Belegaer
Construction: great E > beleg S; sea E > aer S

Name: Ardhon Iaur Arnor
Construction: ardhon S - realm E; iaur S - old E; ar- S - high E; dor S - land E; ar + dor > arnor S

Name: Côf Belfalas
Construction: côf S - bay E; beleg S - great E; falas S - shore E; beleg + falas > belfalas S

Name: Bay of Belfalas
Construction: bay E > côf S; great E > beleg S; shore E > falas S; beleg + falas S > belfalas S

Name: Arthedain
Construction: ardhon S - realm E; edain S - men E; ardhon + edain -> arthedain

Name: Rhudaur
Construction: rhûn S - east E; daur S - forest E; rhûn + daur S > rhudaur S

Name: Minhiriath
Construction: min- S - between E; sirion S - river E; -ath S - plural; min + sirion > minhirion S; sirion + ath > siriath S; minhirion + ath > minhiriath S

Name: Enedwaith
Construction: gwaith S - realm E; enedh S - middle E

Name: Hithaeglir
Construction: hith 'mist', aeglir 'mountain range'

Name: Sûza
Attested: The Return of the King, Appendix F

Name: Sûzat
Attested: Tolkien, The Peoples of Middle-earth, Vol. XII of The History of Middle-earth, p. 45.

Name: Nindalf
Construction: nîn 'wet', talf 'flat field, flat land'

Name: Lô Fern
Construction: Dead Marshes > Marshes of Death; marsh > lô; death > fern

Name: Fanuidhol
Construction: cloudy E > fanui S; head E > dôl S

Name: Sarnathrad
Construction: stone E > sarn S (Lost Road p430); ford E > athrad S

Name: Athrad Iaur
Construction: old ford; ford / crossing > athrad; old > iaur

Name: Eryn Teryg
Construction: trollshaws > troll woods > woods of trolls; woods > eryn; teryg > trolls; teryg : torog :: trolls : troll

Name: Eryn Ost
Notes: Chet derives from Latin, meaning "fortified camp" - lost reference

Name: Forochel
Construction: north E > forod S; -chel from KHEL 'freeze'

Name: Eldalondë
Notes: Attested as a name in Númenor

Name: Pelargir
Construction: pel 'fenced field'; ar 'royal'; ceir 'ships'

Name: Ethraid Poros
Construction: crossings of poros; crossings > ethraid

Name: Argonath
Construction: ar- S - high E; gond S - stone E; ar + gond + ath > argonath

Name: Pelennor
Construction: Possibly pel-ennor 'fenced field-central land'; perhaps more likely *pelen-nor 'fenced land'

Name: Lond Umbar
Construction: haven of umbar; haven > lond

Name: Men Harad
Construction: the harad road; road > men

Name: Ered Moria
Construction: mountains of moria; ered > mountains

Name: Argirith
Construction: high pass; ar > high; cirith > pass

Name: Emyn Nim
Construction: white downs; downs > hills > emyn; white > nim, as in Ered Nimrais

Name: Rhúnnag
Construction: east bight; east > rhún; bight > bite > nag, Ety/374 OS nak- (NAK)
Notes: A "bight" is a bend or curve in a river. It has nothing to do with "bite".

Name: Men Eryn Iaur
Construction: old forest road; old > iaur; forest > woods > eryn; road > way > men

Name: Parth Celebrant
Construction: Field of Celebrant; field > parth

Name: Nanduhirion
Construction: nan 'valley'; dû 'dimness'; sirion 'streams'

Name: Athrad Imladris
Construction: Ford of Rivendell; ford > crossing > athrad; crossing : crossings :: athrad : ethraid; Rivendell > Imladris

Name: Iant Vedui
Construction: The Last Bridge; bridge > iant; vedui > medui > last
Notes: medui [] adj. lastna vedui, Arvedui LotR/I:XII, LotR/A(iv)OS *metåia, CE *metâjâ (MET) -- http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=medui&phon=ipa

Name: Úanló
Construction: Ettenmoors > Etten + Moors; etten > monster > úan; moors > marshes > ló; This construction is incorrect as "moor" in this case refers to a "high barren land"

Name: Bruinen
Construction: loud E > brui S; water E > nen S

Name: Carnen
Construction: red E > caran S; water E > nen S; loud + water E > caran + nen S > carnen S

Name: Rhúnaer
Construction: east E > rhûn S; sea E > aer S; rhûn + aer S > rhunaer S

Name: Iorost
Construction: Aldburg > old fortress; old > iaur; fortress > ost; iorost : iaur + ost :: iorhael : iaur + hael
TODO: Need to get a reference for the attested ior-hael

Name: Eryn Firien
Construction: Firien Wood; wood E > trees E > eryn S

Name: Cîl Rohan
Construction: Gap of Rohan E; gap E > cîl S
Notes: cîl [] n. cleft, pass between hills, gorgeEty/365OS *kil- (KIL) -- http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=c%EEl&phon=ipa

Name: Ethir Onodló
Construction: Mouths of Entwash; mouths > ethir, as in Ethir Anduin

Name: Athrad Onodló
Construction: Entwade > Ford of Entwash; ford > athrad; Entwash > Onodló

Name: Lossir
Construction: snow E > loss S; river E > sîr S; loss + sîr > lossir

Name: Lô Edrein
Construction: Fenmarch > Fen + March; fen > marsh > lô; march / mark > border > edrein; edrein > ed + rhein; edrein : ed + rhein :: amrún : am + rhûn
Notes: edrain [] ( edrein ) n. borderEty/383, X/EIed+rain, OS *etregna (ET, REG) -- http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=edrain&phon=ipa

Name: Andeithel
Construction: Langwell -> lang + well; lang G > long E > and S; well / spring E > eithel S

Name: Mithnen
Construction: Greylin > [river] grey [diminuitive?]; grey E > mith S; river E > waters E > nen S

Name: Barad Durin*
Construction: Durin's Tower > Tower of Durin; tower > barad

Name: Amon Craban
Construction: Ravenhill > raven + hill > hill of ravens; raven E > craban S; craban : crebain :: raven : ravens; hill E > amon S

Name: Rudhras
Construction: Starkhorn > stark + horn; stark E > bald E > rûdh S; horn E > rasg S > ras S, as in Caradhras
Notes: rasg [] ( rhasg ) n. horn (especially on living animal, but also applied to mountains)Ety/383, X/RHOS *rask- (RAS) -- http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=rasg&cognate=horn&phon=ipa

Name: Mornorod
Construction: dwimor > dark > morn S; berg > mountain > orod; dwimor possibly from dweomer, magic?

Name: Nen Cenedril
Construction: Mirrormere > mirror + mere > Lake Mirror; mirror E > cenedril S; mere E > lake / water E > nen S

Name: Orod Gram
Construction: Mt. Gram; mountain E > orod S

Name: Caras Perian
Construction: Hobbiton > Hobbit Town; town / city E > caras S; hobbit E > perian S

Name: Pendlanthir
Construction: Stair Falls; stair E > declivity E > pend S; stairway E > pendrath S; pendrath > pend + rath; rath > path / way; stairway : stair :: pendrath : pend; falls / waterfalls E > lanthir S as in Lanthir Rauros
Notes:
pend [] ( penn ) n. declivityEty/380, X/ND1OS *pende (PED)
 -- http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=pend&phon=ipa

pendrath [] ( pendrad ) n. passage up or down slope, stairwayEty/380, X/ND3pend+rath, pend+râd
 -- http://www.jrrvf.com/cgi-bin/hisweloke/sindarin.cgi?search=pendrath&cognate=stair&phon=ipa

Name: Sargond
Construction: Carrock > car + rock; car anglo saxon > rock E > sarn S; rock / stone E > gond S

Name: Emyn Ring
Construction: Coldfells > cold + fells; fells E > hills E > emyn S; cold E > ring S, as in Ringló

Name: Eryn Morn
Construction: Dimholt > dim + holt; dim / dark E > morn S; holt E > woods E > eryn S

Name: Eryn Uireb
Construction: Everholt > ever + holt; ever / eternal E > uireb S; holt E / woods E > eryn S

Name: Imladnûr
Construction: Deeping Comb E; deeping E > deep E > nur S; comb E > narrow valley E > valley E > imlad S

Name: Andnen
Construction: Long Lake E; long E > and S; lake / water E > nen S

Name: Andló
Construction: Long Marshes E; long E > and S; marshes E > ló S

Name: Amon Lhaw
Construction: ear E > lhaw S

Name: Perth Ninglor
Construction: fields E > perth S; Gladden E > Ninglor S

Name: Annon Caradhras
Construction: Redhorn Gate E; Redhorn E > Caradhras S; gate E > annon S

Name: Erynrâd
Construction: Forest Path; forest E > eryn S; path / track E > râd S; vs. road / path E > rath S

Name: Erynduin
Construction: Forest River; forest / woods E > eryn S; river E > duin S
